they found no gold, they broke thirteen vitrines and threw the antiquities on the floor," Zahi Hawass said on his blog. The looters then entered Tutankhamun's galleries and opened one case. The criminals found a statue of the king on a panther, broke it, and threw it on the floor, he said. Zahi Hawass added that all of the damage can be restored. As a result, as reported by AP, Egypt deployed police and soldiers to the museum to secure its artifacts.
